Medical Terminology.Description: A course designed to cover the terminology and abbreviations used in the clinical sciences.

TechnicalAndDigitalSkills: Knowledge of radiopharmaceutical production and quality assurance
Understanding of imaging modalities such as PET/CT and MRI
InterpersonalAndCommunicationSkills: Effective communication with patients and medical teams
Collaboration with healthcare professionals
Educating patients on procedures and safety measures
Maintaining professionalism in clinical settings
Providing clear and concise reports on imaging results
ProblemSolvingAndAnalyticalSkills: Analyzing diagnostic imaging results
Troubleshooting issues in nuclear medicine procedures
Evaluating emerging technologies for clinical application
Developing solutions for complex medical imaging challenges
Correlating imaging findings with clinical data

Fundamental Concepts in Nuclear Medicine.Description: A course designed to cover the physical principles related to nuclear medicine technology.  The methods and mathematics of radioactive decay, types of radiation, radiation interactions, origins of radionuclides, including SPECT and PET/CT radionuclides also presented.

TechnicalAndDigitalSkills: Knowledge of radiopharmaceutical production and quality assurance
Understanding of imaging modalities such as PET/CT and MRI

Collaboration with healthcare professionals
Educating patients on procedures and safety measures

Troubleshooting issues in nuclear medicine procedures
Evaluating emerging technologies for clinical application
Developing solutions for complex medical imaging challenges
Correlating imaging findings with clinical data

Nuclear Instrumentation.Description: This course is designed to familiarize the student with the theory, operation and quality assurance associated with the instrumentation found in a typical nuclear medicine department. The course also covers the instrumentation of PET/CT scanners as well as the common radiopharmaceuticals, imaging protocols, and radiation safety currently employed in diagnostic PET/CT imaging practice.

TechnicalAndDigitalSkills: Knowledge of radiopharmaceutical production and quality assurance
Understanding of imaging modalities such as PET/CT and MRI
InterpersonalAndCommunicationSkills: Effective communication with patients and medical teams
Collaboration with healthcare professionals

Troubleshooting issues in nuclear medicine procedures
Evaluating emerging technologies for clinical application
Developing solutions for complex medical imaging challenges
Correlating imaging findings with clinical data

Radiation Health.Description: Discussions of radiation effects on cellular systems as well as guidelines for radiation protection and safe handling of radioactive materials in the nuclear medicine clinical setting.

Nuclear Medicine Technology I.Description: A course  designed to cover the nuclear medicine procedures and protocols of the gastrointestinal, genitourinary, central nervous, skeletal systems. Other current or emerging clinical nuclear medicine procedures are also covered.

Understanding of imaging modalities such as PET/CT and MRI

Nuclear Medicine Technology II.Description: A course designed to cover the nuclear medicine protocols and procedures of the respiratory, cardiovascular, endocrine, infection/inflammation and lymphatic systems.  Other current and emerging clinical nuclear medicine procedures and protocols are also presented.

Radiopharmacy.Description: This course is designed to cover the concepts and techniques related to the field of radiopharmacy for nuclear medicine technology practice. The production, preparation, uses and quality assurance of radiopharmaceuticals are presented. Interventional and adjunctive pharmaceutical agents used in nuclear medicine will be covered.

TechnicalAndDigitalSkills: Knowledge of radiopharmaceutical production and quality assurance
Understanding of imaging modalities such as PET/CT and MRI
InterpersonalAndCommunicationSkills: Effective communication with patients and medical teams
Collaboration with healthcare professionals

Correlating imaging findings with clinical data

Nuclear Medicine and Molecular Imaging.Description: This course covers the concepts, instrumentation and procedures pertaining to molecular imaging as related to nuclear medicine. Topics include: advanced Positron Emission Tomography (PET), Computed Tomography (CT), PET/CT, Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI), nuclear cardiology, theranostics, and other emerging technologies. Cross-sectional anatomy and radionuclide therapy, including monoclonal antibodies are also discussed. Review of all content for board examinations.

TechnicalAndDigitalSkills: Knowledge of radiopharmaceutical production and quality assurance
Understanding of imaging modalities such as PET/CT and MRI
InterpersonalAndCommunicationSkills: Effective communication with patients and medical teams
Collaboration with healthcare professionals

Administration and Management in Nuclear.Description: This writing intensive, capstone course is designed to provide a review of the administration, management, policies, and practices relevant to nuclear medicine technology.
